intro: Elephantopus biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It features slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a cluster, making it a recognizable species within its native range.
